question: As of December-2019, India has reduced emission intensity of its GDP by what percent?
explanation:
India has reduced the emissions intensity of its GDP, that is emissions per unit of GDP, by 21% .The country is aiming to achieve the goal of 35% emissions reduction as promised in the Paris summit in 2015. It was mentioned that the Indian government has provided 80 million LPG gas connections, effectively replacing conventional firewood cooking stoves.
Paris Agreement is an international agreement that was initiated with an aim to combat climate change. The governments of 195 nations were gathered in Paris, France, and discussed a possible new global agreement on climate change from 30 November to 11 December 2015. It aimed to reduce global greenhouse gas emissions.
